data.title: Johnston promoted at Telegraph
data.meta_description: 2.30pm: Long-standing Daily Telegraph home affairs editor Philip Johnston has been promoted to to the post of assistant editor. By Stephen Brook.
data.text:
Long-standing Daily Telegraph home affairs editor Philip Johnston has been promoted to the post of assistant editor.

Johnston, who has been with the Daily Telegraph for nearly 19 years, will continue in his role current role as home affairs editor.

"I am delighted to welcome Philip to the senior editorial executive team. He will be a great asset," said the Daily Telegraph editor, Will Lewis.

Johnston's weekly Home Front column launched in 2004.

His promotion comes after the Telegraph boosted its home news team by hiring Robert Winnett from the Sunday Times and Gordon Rayner from the Daily Mail, as chief reporter.

The paper has also hired Andrew Porter from the Sun to be political editor, replacing George Jones.
